                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Northumberland Strait Microbial Water Quality dataset is an archival collection of faecal loads in South East New Brunswick waters. Since 2017, we have been assembling historic microbial water quality data with an aim to generate a highly resolved and ongoing understanding of the sources, timing and fates of faecal contamination in the Shediac Bay and Northumberland Strait areas. The data comes in large part from Shellfish Surveys completed by Environment and Climate Change Canada. However, new data is continually being generated by various government agency, Non-Governmental Organization and citizen science sources and is scattered throughout publications, on different websites in various formats or being held by various government agencies. It is our hope that posting this data on an up-to-date, open-platform, public access service like DataStream will help researchers, managers and policy makers alike as they work to address the most probable sources of contamination in South East New Brunswick waters.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-bqyj-1880
notes: The Northumberland Strait Microbial Water Quality dataset is an archival collection of faecal loads in South East New Brunswick waters. Since 2017, we have been assembling historic microbial water quality data with an aim to generate a highly resolved and ongoing understanding of the sources, timing and fates of faecal contamination in the Shediac Bay and Northumberland Strait areas. The data comes in large part from Shellfish Surveys completed by Environment and Climate Change Canada. However, new data is continually being generated by various government agency, Non-Governmental Organization and citizen science sources and is scattered throughout publications, on different websites in various formats or being held by various government agencies. It is our hope that posting this data on an up-to-date, open-platform, public access service like DataStream will help researchers, managers and policy makers alike as they work to address the most probable sources of contamination in South East New Brunswick waters.

notes_translated.en: The Northumberland Strait Microbial Water Quality dataset is an archival collection of faecal loads in South East New Brunswick waters. Since 2017, we have been assembling historic microbial water quality data with an aim to generate a highly resolved and ongoing understanding of the sources, timing and fates of faecal contamination in the Shediac Bay and Northumberland Strait areas. The data comes in large part from Shellfish Surveys completed by Environment and Climate Change Canada. However, new data is continually being generated by various government agency, Non-Governmental Organization and citizen science sources and is scattered throughout publications, on different websites in various formats or being held by various government agencies. It is our hope that posting this data on an up-to-date, open-platform, public access service like DataStream will help researchers, managers and policy makers alike as they work to address the most probable sources of contamination in South East New Brunswick waters.
notes_translated.fr: L'ensemble de données sur la qualité microbienne de l'eau dans le détroit de Northumberland est une collection d'archives des charges fécales dans les eaux du sud-est du Nouveau-Brunswick. Depuis 2017, nous rassemblons des données microbiennes historiques sur la qualité de l'eau dans le but de générer une compréhension approfondie et continue des sources, du calendrier et du devenir de la contamination fécale dans les régions de la baie de Shediac et du détroit de Northumberland. Les données proviennent en grande partie des enquêtes sur les mollusques réalisées par Environnement et Changement climatique Canada. Cependant, de nouvelles données sont continuellement générées par diverses agences gouvernementales, organisations non gouvernementales et sources de science citoyenne et sont dispersées dans des publications, sur différents sites Web sous différents formats ou détenues par diverses agences gouvernementales. Nous espérons que la publication de ces données sur un service d'accès public à jour et à plateforme ouverte tel que DataStream aidera les chercheurs, les gestionnaires et les décideurs à s'attaquer aux sources de contamination les plus probables dans les eaux du sud-est du Nouveau-Brunswick.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Mount Allison Phyto Lab Data

title_translated.fr: Données du laboratoire de phytothérapie de Mount Allison
